WRITING.TITLE: When she thinks you #8217;re going for her belly, Mochi gets spooked.

WRITING.TEXT: It #8217;s a kitty harness! I #8217;m not a fan of collars. Even breakaway ones for my younger cats. My grandparents had a kitten nearly hang herself on a breakaway collar because she didn #8217;t have enough weight to break it open, so when cats are young, I just go with a harness.
She loves to have her belly floof scritched. But no more than three times.
I get so tired of hearing, #8220;Is that the best you can offer me? #8221; or #8220;Do you think we can bring that price down a little? #8221;
#8220;What do you mean this special edition figure is $50? I didn #8217;t even see the price sticker on the back. That #8217;s too much for me, can we knock some off that total? #8221;
It varies by location. I #8217;m a GA and my scheduled time varies from 15 hours/week to 40 hours/week.

I could quit two of my three jobs, go to college to get into my dream career, pay for my mother #8217;s chemotherapy, buy my grandparents the house they #8217;ve always worked to afford but never could, and STILL have so much to donate. It #8217;s crazy to even fathom that amount of money and how much it would change my life. Best of luck to everybody. Can #8217;t wait to see this idea come to fruition.
RemindMe! 3 days Donation for /r/millionairemakers

What doopsloot means by membership info is that your only hope is your friend having a PowerUp Rewards account with Gamestop. If they do AND they used it on that transaction, it will be in their transaction history. Then you can contact customer service with that membership (usually connected with a phone number). You #8217;ll want to make sure you have the information attached to that PUR account because they #8217;ll likely ask questions to verify.

I don #8217;t know why the concept of instant depreciation confuses so many customers. We all know its frustrating, but even if you just opened it (didn #8217;t even take the game out or play it), there no way we can take it back in for the full amount and resell it as brand new. Same thing with systems. How upset would you be if you bought a #8220;new #8221; system or game and opened it and it had obviously been used before?

I mean... there #8217;s a small chance that he could call the store he bought it from and explain the situation. If he can tell them the day he bought it, the approximate time, and the register he was at (usually a #8220;the middle one #8221; or #8220;the one closest to the door #8221; is good enough), there #8217;s a chance they can find the transaction. I know my store would try their darndest to help but not every store will be the same. But it #8217;s always worth a good try!
I #8217;m relatively new and only work truck, stocking, and register. I wish.
That would make more sense! Thank you!
Have you played Detroit: Become Human?
It #8217;s a great game! Definitely look into it!
It was especially bad around Christmas. They overestimate how many 50-piece pots and pans sets will fit on the cart.

I feel you. Things that used to make me so happy (bookstores, new art supplies, etc.) just don #8217;t anymore. It #8217;s always hard the first time you realize that. I #8217;m getting back to forcing myself to pretend I #8217;m happy about them anyways. Maybe one day it #8217;ll be genuine again. Hope things start looking up for you. #128149;
I push baby after sorting cosmetics and the baby section is always equally disgusting. The strollers/car seats section seems like the graveyard for the empty boxes of thefts past.

It definitely is exhausting. To be honest, I don #8217;t have much of a friend group at the moment (many of them graduated college and are all doing their own thing), so I don #8217;t have to do much pretending for others, which helps. I mostly try to pretend for myself, so if I just can #8217;t do it on any given day, no one notices but me. I also make compromises with myself. I /want/ to stay home in bed and watch Youtube. I /used/ to go to coffee shops and draw or write. So sometimes, I get myself to go to a coffee shop and watch Youtube on my laptop and enjoy being out. I know it #8217;s more likely that I #8217;ll convince myself to do that than go 100%. You should try that sometime!

In the end, he #8217;s right. It is up to you. That #8217;s something that I #8217;m trying to learn as well. If we give up on ourselves and expect other people to fix our lives for us, we #8217;re always going to be left disappointed. Are you actively taking baby steps towards getting better? Therapy? Medication? Maybe self-help books (I know that sounds dumb, but I have some for BPD and they #8217;ve actually been helpful).

If money isn #8217;t a huge issue, you could always consider some medicinal genotyping tests. It gives you and your doctor insight into what medications may be more effective for you instead of dabbling in a bunch and wasting your time. It looks at how your body metabolizes various drugs and will tell you if your body is too slow or fast to metabolize it (because this makes the drug less effective). It #8217;s not crazy expensive, I believe. But definitely not the cheapest. Otherwise, medication is definitely worth a try. Most people don #8217;t respond to JUST therapy or JUST medication. It usually takes a good balance of both to get to a place where you can focus on healing and growing instead of just surviving.

A lot of them focus on mindfulness and meditation, so you have to go into it with an open mind. Look into workbooks. Give them a chance and don #8217;t give up too quickly. Also, if you find a regular therapist or psychiatrist, they can vouch for you and discuss medication with your parents if you #8217;re under 18. They #8217;ll be able to take your parents #8217; concerns and openly discuss it on a professional level. Your mindset seems very similar to my own lately #8212; and to be honest, the only thing I #8217;ve found that really has helped me has been a balance of medication and Dialectical Behavioral Therapy. Good luck! #128149;

You may hate yourself now, but life is never stagnant. Time is gonna keep on moving along and you #8217;ll always be changing and growing. Just because you hate yourself now, doesn #8217;t mean you #8217;ll hate future you. So for now, keep on surviving until you get to a place where you can start living instead of just surviving. My inbox is always open. #128149;
So proud of you! #128149;

I feel you. You #8217;re not alone. But that #8217;s what we #8217;re all here for. We #8217;re all struggling, but want to help each other. Think about how many bad days, weeks, months, or even years you #8217;ve had. They felt endless and hopeless right? Well, guess what. You survived those. So I believe in you when I say you can survive these bad times, too. Keep it up. Even if you #8217;re just surviving for now, that #8217;s enough. Look forward to a day when you can live and not just survive. Inbox is always open. #128149;

WRITING.TITLE: [WIP] Making nerdy pins for my coworkers!

WRITING.TEXT: No particular #8220;patterns #8221; used, but have used plenty of 8-bit style reference pictures.

You #8217;re 17. You haven #8217;t even had the chance to get out on your own and experience anything. Just keep surviving and give it time, and work on yourself instead of caring so much of what others think. Life is hard, but get to the good stuff and it #8217;ll make all the bad worth it.
That #8217;s Calcifer from Howl #8217;s Moving Castle #8212; a Miyazaki film. If you appreciate visually pretty things, it #8217;s always worth a watch! Thank you! #128149;
Thank you! I regret that you can see the rainbow peeking through the space, but I #8217;m hoping that will go away when I fill it in for the back!

Of course! Like I said, I don #8217;t know a lot about it when it comes to prices or requirements or anything #8212; I just know a close friend of mine utilized it and has been having much more luck. Hope you start feeling better! #128149;
Just did, thank you.

I #8217;m really sorry to hear that you had to deal with it, too. I think the worst thing is that life was so great before him. I grew up in foster care, but despite that, I had gotten basically a full ride to a university. I was a year away from graduating when I met him, and things went downhill. I just hope that I can get back on my feet so I can complete my education. I know it #8217;s likely a couple years away, but a girl can dream. #128149;
